title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7904.5 - Procedure on petition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7904.5 - Procedure on petition

State Regulations

Following the filing of a petition, there shall be a
period of five business days during which any interested person, other than the
appellant, may file comments with the commissioner with proof that a copy of
such comments was served upon the appellant. Comments shall be accompanied by a
written statement that all factual assertions in the comments are true, and
shall be signed and dated by the person making the assertions. Following the
comment period, the commissioner shall make a decision in writing disposing of
the appeal. The decision shall contain findings of fact and conclusions of law, and shall be served by the commissioner by registered mail upon the appellant
and all other person to whom the order being appealed was
addressed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7904.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
